===========================================================

**Government Tender Announcement: Request for Standing Offer**

### Project Description

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites qualified contractors to submit their offers for a standing offer that encompasses the fin clipping and coded-wire tagging of juvenile salmonids at various DFO hatcheries and DFO-contracted hatcheries throughout British Columbia.

### Objective

The primary objective of this standing offer is to obtain high-quality fin clipping and coded-wire tagging services for juvenile salmonids at multiple facilities throughout BC. The tagging and clipping activities are essential for identifying fish for harvest in fisheries, estimating total catch and distribution, and assessing rebuilding efforts in stocks of concern.

### Background

Fin clipping and coded-wire tagging of juvenile salmonids are crucial for various management models, including international fisheries management. These services may be contracted out annually, with the financial value fluctuating based on factors such as funding levels, treaty obligations, fish abundance, and assessment requirements.

### Scope of Work

Selected contractors will provide fin clipping and coded-wire tagging activities in accordance with established procedures outlined in Nichols & Hillaby (1990) and Northwest Marine Technologies (https://www.nmt.us/about/technical-manuals/). Contract services will adhere to the tasks, technical specifications, and deliverables outlined in this Standing Offer.

### Period of the Standing Offer

The standing offer can be called-up from February 1, 2023, to January 31, 2028.
